alert.note: Alert for Clay; East Marshall; East Polk; Norman; Pennington; Red Lake; Roseau (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 13 at 9:46PM CST until February 14 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow creating reduced visibilities under a quarter mile at times especially in open country. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Minnesota and southeast North Dakota. * WHEN...Until 3 AM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.

area.areaDesc: Clay; East Marshall; East Polk; Norman; Pennington; Red Lake; Roseau
